summary: This document contains email exchanges between Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell from 2009 and 2015. The 2009 emails discuss legal concerns about being served with a subpoena and strategies to avoid testifying. The 2015 email shows Epstein encouraging Maxwell to maintain a public presence and mentions a Swedish ocean ambassador.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Email sender, subject of legal concern
persons.context: Communicates with Ghislaine Maxwell about legal strategy regarding a subpoena and later encourages her to act normally in public.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Email recipient, referred to as Gmax/G Maxwell
persons.context: Expresses concern about being served a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein and later is urged by Epstein to maintain a public demeanor.

persons.name: Lisa Svenson
persons.context: Mentioned by Epstein as having stated that no one on her ocean panel takes 'this stuff' seriously and that Maxwell would be welcome at ocean conferences.

connections.description: Epstein advises Maxwell on legal strategy to avoid testifying and later encourages her public behavior, indicating close coordination regarding legal matters.
Epstein mentions having had Lisa Svenson over and relays her comments about Maxwell being welcome at ocean conferences.
Epstein suggests Maxwell would be welcome at ocean conferences based on Svenson's comments, indicating a potential social or professional connection.

events.title: Attempted service of subpoena
events.description: A person came to Maxwell's house trying to serve her with a subpoena that had 'Jane Doe' and her name on it, related to a lawsuit involving Epstein.

events.title: Legal strategy discussion
events.description: Epstein advises Maxwell they can file a protective order to prevent her from having to testify, comparing it to a harassment lawsuit.

events.title: Maxwell's request regarding public perception
events.description: Maxwell expresses to Epstein that she would appreciate if it came out that a certain woman was his girlfriend from end of 1999 to 2002.

events.title: Epstein's encouragement to Maxwell
events.description: Epstein urges Maxwell to act like she has done nothing wrong, go outside with her head high, attend parties, and mentions Lisa Svenson's comments.

keyFacts: In 2009, Ghislaine Maxwell was concerned about being served a subpoena related to Jeffrey Epstein, indicating her involvement in legal matters surrounding him.
Jeffrey Epstein advised Maxwell on a legal strategy to avoid testifying, suggesting filing a protective order claiming she was not near the relevant person during key dates.
In 2015, Epstein encouraged Maxwell to maintain a normal public life, stating she had 'done nothing wrong' and should attend parties, suggesting ongoing coordination to manage public perception.
Epstein mentioned Lisa Svenson, a Swedish ocean ambassador, who reportedly said no one on her ocean panel takes 'this stuff' seriously and that Maxwell would be welcome at ocean conferences.
The emails are marked as confidential and potentially attorney-client privileged, indicating the sensitive nature of the communications.
